actions.title: events.get
actions.description: Returns the full record for all events that have occurred since the sync token was created.

resource.description: A resource ID to subscribe to. The resource can be a task or project.

sync.description: A sync token received from the last request, or none on first sync. Events will be returned from the point in time that the sync token was generated. On your first request, omit the sync token. The response will be the same as for an expired sync token, and will include a new valid sync token.If the sync token is too old (which may happen from time to time) the API will return a error, and include a fresh token in the response.

actions.title: webhooks.post
actions.description: Establishing a webhook is a two-part process. First, a simple HTTP POST similar to any other resource creation. Since you could have multiple webhooks we recommend specifying a unique local id for each target.

resource.description: A resource ID to subscribe to. The resource can be a task or project.

target.description: The URL to receive the HTTP POST.

active.description: If true, the webhook will send events - if false it is considered inactive and will not generate events.

actions.title: workspaces.workspace_gid.typeahead.get
actions.description: Retrieves objects in the workspace based on an auto-completion/typeahead search algorithm. This feature is meant to provide results quickly, so do not rely on this API to provide extremely accurate search results. The result set is limited to a single page of results with a maximum size, so you won’t be able to fetch large numbers of results.

workspace_gid.description: The workspace to fetch objects from.

type.description: The type of values the typeahead should return. You can choose from one of the following: custom_field, project, tag, task, and user. Note that unlike in the names of endpoints, the types listed here are in singular form (e.g. ). Using multiple types is not yet supported.

query.description: The string that will be used to search for relevant objects. If an empty string is passed in, the API will currently return an empty result set.

count.description: The number of results to return. The default is if this parameter is omitted, with a minimum of and a maximum of . If there are fewer results found than requested, all will be returned.

name.description: The name of the workspace.

resource_subtype.description: The type of custom field. Must be one of the given values.

precision.description: Only relevant for custom fields of type ‘Number’. This field dictates the number of places after the decimal to round to, i.e. 0 is integer values, 1 rounds to the nearest tenth, and so on. Must be between 0 and 6, inclusive.

actions.title: tasks.post
actions.description: Creating a new task is as easy as POSTing to the /tasks endpoint with a data block containing the fields you’d like to set on the task. Any unspecified fields will take on default values.

workspace.description: The workspace to create a task in.

html_notes.description: The notes of the project with formatting as HTML.

layout.description: The layout (board or list view) of the project.

actions.title: projects.get
actions.description: Returns the compact project records for some filtered set of projects. Use one or more of the parameters provided to filter the projects returned.

workspace.description: The workspace or organization to filter projects on.

team.description: The team to filter projects on.

archived.description: Only return projects whose field takes on the value of this parameter.

name.description: Name of the project. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

owner.description: The current owner of the project, may be null.

due_date.description: The day on which this project is due. This takes a date with format YYYY-MM-DD.

start_on.description: The day on which this project starts. This takes a date with format YYYY-MM-DD.

public.description: True if the project is public to the organization. If false, do not share this project with other users in this organization without explicitly checking to see if they have access.

color.description: Color of the project. Must be either or one of: , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , .

notes.description: More detailed, free-form textual information associated with the project.

html_notes.description: The notes of the project with formatting as HTML.

layout.description: The layout (board or list view) of the project.

actions.title: tasks.task_gid.addDependencies.post
actions.description: Marks a set of tasks as dependencies of this task, if they are not already dependencies. A task can have at most 15 dependencies.

task_gid.description: The task to add dependencies to.

dependencies.description: An array of task IDs that this task should depend on.

assignee.description: User to which this task is assigned, or if the task is unassigned.

assignee_status.description: Scheduling status of this task for the user it is assigned to. This field can only be set if the is non-null.

completed.description: True if the task is currently marked complete, false if not.

custom_fields.description: Array of custom fields applied to the task. These custom fields represent the values recorded on this task for a particular custom field. For example, these fields will contain an property for custom fields of type , a property for custom fields of type , and so on. Please note that the id returned on each custom field value to the id of the custom field, which allows referencing the custom field metadata through the endpoint.

due_on.description: Date on which this task is due, or null if the task has no due date. This takes a date with YYYY-MM-DD format and should not be used together with .

due_at.description: Date and time on which this task is due, or null if the task has no due time. This takes a UTC timestamp and should not be used together with .

external.description: The external field allows you to store app-specific metadata on tasks, including an id that can be used to retrieve tasks and a data blob that can store app-specific character strings. Note that you will need to authenticate with Oauth to access or modify this data. Once an external id is set, you can use the notation to reference your object anywhere in the API where you may use the original object id. See the page on Custom External Data for more details.

followers.description: Array of users following this task.

liked.description: True if the task is liked by the authorized user, false if not.

name.description: Name of the task. This is generally a short sentence fragment that fits on a line in the UI for maximum readability. However, it can be longer.

notes.description: More detailed, free-form textual information associated with the task.

html_notes.description: The notes of the text with formatting as HTML.

projects.description: Array of projects this task is associated with. At task creation time, this array can be used to add the task to many projects at once. After task creation, these associations can be modified using the and endpoints.

start_on.description: Date on which this task is due, or null if the task has no start date. This field takes a date with YYYY-MM-DD format. or must be present in the request when setting or unsetting the parameter.

workspace.description: The workspace this task is associated with. Once created, task cannot be moved to a different workspace. This attribute can only be specified at creation time.

memberships.description: Array of projects this task is associated with and the section it is in. At task creation time, this array can be used to add the task to specific sections. After task creation, these associations can be modified using the and endpoints. Note that over time, more types of memberships may be added to this property.

tags.description: Array of tags associated with this task. This property may be specified on creation using just an array of tag IDs. In order to change tags on an existing task use and .
